algorithm: {This algorithm selects a solution from the archive based on a weighted sum of objectives, then applies a hybrid local search combining segment reversal and edge insertion to generate a neighbor solution while ensuring feasibility.}
function:
def select_neighbor(archive: List[Tuple[np.ndarray, Tuple[float, float]]], instance: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_1: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_2: np.ndarray) -> np.ndarray:
    objectives = [obj for _, obj in archive]
    mean_obj = np.mean(objectives, axis=0)
    std_obj = np.std(objectives, axis=0)
    weights = (1 / (std_obj + 1e-6)) / np.sum(1 / (std_obj + 1e-6))

    scores = [weights[0] * obj[0] + weights[1] * obj[1] for _, obj in archive]
    selected_idx = np.argmin(scores)
    base_solution = archive[selected_idx][0].copy()

    new_solution = base_solution.copy()
    n = len(new_solution)

    # Segment reversal with objective-aware selection
    segment_length = max(2, min(n // 4, random.randint(2, n // 2)))
    start = random.randint(0, n - segment_length)
    end = start + segment_length
    new_solution[start:end] = new_solution[start:end][::-1]

    # Edge insertion with distance-based selection
    i = random.randint(0, n - 1)
    j = (i + random.randint(1, n // 2)) % n
    if i > j:
        i, j = j, i
    edge = new_solution[i:j+1]
    new_solution = np.concatenate([new_solution[:i], new_solution[j+1:], edge])

    # Validate solution
    if not np.array_equal(np.sort(new_solution), np.sort(base_solution)):
        new_solution = base_solution

    return new_solution

def select_neighbor(archive: List[Tuple[np.ndarray, Tuple[float, float]]], instance: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_1: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_2: np.ndarray) -> np.ndarray:
    base_solution = archive[0][0].copy()
    new_solution = base_solution.copy()
    n = len(new_solution)

    # Novel local search: adaptive segment rotation and edge insertion
    i = np.random.randint(0, n)
    j = np.random.randint(0, n)
    if i > j:
        i, j = j, i

    if j - i > 2:
        # Rotate a segment and insert it at a new position
        segment = new_solution[i:j]
        rotated_segment = np.roll(segment, np.random.randint(1, len(segment)))
        new_solution = np.concatenate([new_solution[:i], rotated_segment, new_solution[j:]])

        # Insert a randomly selected edge from another part of the tour
        k = np.random.randint(0, n)
        if k < i or k > j:
            edge = new_solution[k:k+2]
            new_solution = np.concatenate([new_solution[:k], edge, new_solution[k:]])

    # Ensure feasibility
    if len(np.unique(new_solution)) != n:
        new_solution = base_solution.copy()

    return new_solution

def select_neighbor(archive: List[Tuple[np.ndarray, Tuple[float, float]]], instance: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_1: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_2: np.ndarray) -> np.ndarray:
    weights = [0.6, 0.4]  # Higher weight for the first objective
    scores = [weights[0] * obj[0] + weights[1] * obj[1] for _, obj in archive]
    selected_idx = np.argmin(scores)
    base_solution = archive[selected_idx][0].copy()

    # Step 2: Apply novel local search strategy
    new_solution = base_solution.copy()
    n = len(new_solution)

    # Randomly select a segment to rotate
    start, end = sorted(random.sample(range(n), 2))
    segment = new_solution[start:end+1]
    rotation = np.random.randint(1, len(segment))
    rotated_segment = np.concatenate([segment[rotation:], segment[:rotation]])
    new_solution[start:end+1] = rotated_segment

    # Randomly select a node to insert elsewhere
    node_pos = np.random.randint(0, n)
    node = new_solution[node_pos]
    new_solution = np.concatenate([new_solution[:node_pos], new_solution[node_pos+1:]])
    insert_pos = np.random.randint(0, len(new_solution))
    new_solution = np.insert(new_solution, insert_pos, node)

    # Randomly swap two edges if they exist
    if n > 2:
        i, j = random.sample(range(n), 2)
        if abs(i - j) > 1:
            new_solution[i], new_solution[j] = new_solution[j], new_solution[i]

    # Ensure feasibility
    if len(np.unique(new_solution)) != n:
        new_solution = base_solution.copy()

    return new_solution

def select_neighbor(archive: List[Tuple[np.ndarray, Tuple[float, float]]], instance: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_1: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_2: np.ndarray) -> np.ndarray:
    weights = [0.6, 0.4]  # Higher weight for the first objective
    scores = [weights[0] * obj[0] + weights[1] * obj[1] for _, obj in archive]
    selected_idx = np.argmin(scores)
    base_solution = archive[selected_idx][0].copy()

    new_solution = base_solution.copy()
    n = len(new_solution)

    # Edge swapping
    i, j = sorted(random.sample(range(n), 2))
    new_solution[i], new_solution[j] = new_solution[j], new_solution[i]

    # Segment shifting
    start, end = sorted(random.sample(range(n), 2))
    segment = new_solution[start:end+1]
    new_solution = np.concatenate([new_solution[:start], new_solution[end+1:], segment])

    # Ensure validity
    if not np.array_equal(np.sort(new_solution), np.sort(base_solution)):
        new_solution = base_solution

    return new_solution

def select_neighbor(archive: List[Tuple[np.ndarray, Tuple[float, float]]], instance: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_1: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_2: np.ndarray) -> np.ndarray:
    if not archive:
        raise ValueError("Archive is empty")

    # Normalize objectives to create a selection probability distribution
    objectives = np.array([obj for _, obj in archive])
    normalized_obj = objectives / (np.sum(objectives, axis=0) + 1e-10)  # Avoid division by zero
    selection_probs = np.mean(normalized_obj, axis=1)  # Average normalized objectives
    selection_probs = selection_probs / np.sum(selection_probs)  # Normalize to probabilities

    selected_idx = np.random.choice(len(archive), p=selection_probs)
    base_solution = archive[selected_idx][0].copy()

    # Hybrid local search: combine edge insertion and segment reversal
    new_solution = base_solution.copy()
    n = len(new_solution)

    # Step 1: Edge insertion (move a random edge to a new position)
    i, j = sorted(random.sample(range(n), 2))
    edge = new_solution[i:j+1]
    remaining = np.concatenate([new_solution[:i], new_solution[j+1:]])
    insert_pos = random.randint(0, len(remaining))
    new_solution = np.concatenate([remaining[:insert_pos], edge, remaining[insert_pos:]])

    # Step 2: Segment reversal (reverse a random segment to improve local structure)
    k, l = sorted(random.sample(range(n), 2))
    new_solution[k:l+1] = new_solution[k:l+1][::-1]

    # Ensure feasibility (no duplicates or missing nodes)
    assert len(new_solution) == n and len(np.unique(new_solution)) == n

    return new_solution

def select_neighbor(archive: List[Tuple[np.ndarray, Tuple[float, float]]], instance: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_1: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_2: np.ndarray) -> np.ndarray:
    weights = [0.5, 0.5]  # Equal importance for both objectives
    scores = [weights[0] * obj[0] + weights[1] * obj[1] for _, obj in archive]
    selected_idx = np.argmin(scores)
    base_solution = archive[selected_idx][0].copy()

    # Step 2: Hybrid local search strategy combining edge insertion and segment reversal
    new_solution = base_solution.copy()
    n = len(new_solution)

    # Randomly select a segment to reverse
    start, end = sorted(random.sample(range(n), 2))
    new_solution[start:end+1] = new_solution[start:end+1][::-1]

    # Randomly select an edge to insert elsewhere
    i, j = random.sample(range(n), 2)
    if i > j:
        i, j = j, i
    edge = new_solution[i:j+1]
    new_solution = np.concatenate([new_solution[:i], new_solution[j+1:], edge])

    # Ensure the solution remains a valid tour
    if not np.array_equal(np.sort(new_solution), np.sort(base_solution)):
        new_solution = base_solution  # Fallback to base solution if invalid

    return new_solution

algorithm: {This algorithm selects a solution from the archive, performs a hybrid local search by combining segment reversal and edge swapping, and ensures feasibility while prioritizing solutions with better objective values.}
function:
def select_neighbor(archive: List[Tuple[np.ndarray, Tuple[float, float]]], instance: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_1: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_2: np.ndarray) -> np.ndarray:
    """
    Select a promising solution from the archive and generate a neighbor solution from it.

    Args:
    archive: List of (solution, objective) pairs. Each solution is a numpy array of node IDs.
             Each objective is a tuple of two float values (cost in each space).
    instance: Numpy array of shape (N, 4). Each row corresponds to a node and contains its coordinates in two 2D spaces: (x1, y1, x2, y2).
    distance_matrix_1: Distance matrix in the first objective space.
    distance_matrix_2: Distance matrix in the second objective space.

    Returns:
    A new neighbor solution (numpy array).
    """
    archive_sorted = sorted(archive, key=lambda x: sum(x[1]))
    base_solution = archive_sorted[0][0].copy()
    new_solution = base_solution.copy()
    n = len(new_solution)

    # Hybrid local search: segment reversal and edge swapping
    i = np.random.randint(0, n)
    j = np.random.randint(0, n)
    if i > j:
        i, j = j, i

    if j - i > 1:
        # Reverse a segment
        new_solution[i:j] = new_solution[i:j][::-1]

        # Swap two edges
        k = np.random.randint(0, n)
        l = np.random.randint(0, n)
        if k != l and abs(k - l) > 1:
            new_solution[k], new_solution[l] = new_solution[l], new_solution[k]

    # Ensure feasibility
    if len(np.unique(new_solution)) != n:
        new_solution = base_solution.copy()

    return new_solution

algorithm: {The new algorithm combines a biased selection strategy based on objective normalization with a hybrid local search that alternates between random edge swaps and segment rotations, while incorporating distance-aware perturbations to explore the solution space more effectively.}
function:
def select_neighbor(archive: List[Tuple[np.ndarray, Tuple[float, float]]], instance: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_1: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_2: np.ndarray) -> np.ndarray:
    """
    Select a promising solution from the archive and generate a neighbor solution from it.

    Args:
    archive: List of (solution, objective) pairs. Each solution is a numpy array of node IDs.
             Each objective is a tuple of two float values (cost in each space).
    instance: Numpy array of shape (N, 4). Each row corresponds to a node and contains its coordinates in two 2D spaces: (x1, y1, x2, y2).
    distance_matrix_1: Distance matrix in the first objective space.
    distance_matrix_2: Distance matrix in the second objective space.

    Returns:
    A new neighbor solution (numpy array).
    """
    if not archive:
        raise ValueError("Archive is empty")

    # Selection strategy: prioritize solutions with lower combined objective values
    objectives = np.array([obj for _, obj in archive])
    combined = np.sum(objectives, axis=1)
    selection_probs = np.exp(-combined / np.sum(combined))  # Exponential bias towards better solutions
    selection_probs = selection_probs / np.sum(selection_probs)

    selected_idx = np.random.choice(len(archive), p=selection_probs)
    base_solution = archive[selected_idx][0].copy()
    new_solution = base_solution.copy()
    n = len(new_solution)

    # Hybrid local search: alternate between edge swaps and segment rotations
    for _ in range(2):  # Perform two operations
        if random.random() < 0.5:
            # Edge swap: randomly select two non-adjacent edges and swap them
            a, b = sorted(random.sample(range(n), 2))
            while b - a <= 1:  # Ensure edges are not adjacent
                a, b = sorted(random.sample(range(n), 2))
            new_solution[a], new_solution[b] = new_solution[b], new_solution[a]
        else:
            # Segment rotation: rotate a random segment by a random amount
            k, l = sorted(random.sample(range(n), 2))
            segment = new_solution[k:l+1]
            rotation = random.randint(1, len(segment)-1)
            rotated = np.roll(segment, rotation)
            new_solution[k:l+1] = rotated

    # Ensure feasibility
    assert len(new_solution) == n and len(np.unique(new_solution)) == n

    return new_solution

def select_neighbor(archive: List[Tuple[np.ndarray, Tuple[float, float]]], instance: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_1: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_2: np.ndarray) -> np.ndarray:
    archive_sorted = sorted(archive, key=lambda x: (x[1][0] + x[1][1]))
    base_solution = archive_sorted[0][0].copy()

    # Hybrid local search: combine 2-opt with a novel edge swap strategy
    new_solution = base_solution.copy()
    n = len(new_solution)

    # Randomly select a segment to modify
    i = np.random.randint(0, n)
    j = np.random.randint(0, n)
    if i > j:
        i, j = j, i

    # Apply a novel edge swap strategy
    if j - i > 1:
        # Reverse a segment and swap edges
        new_solution[i:j] = new_solution[i:j][::-1]
        # Swap two non-adjacent edges
        if j - i > 2:
            k = np.random.randint(i+1, j-1)
            new_solution[k], new_solution[k+1] = new_solution[k+1], new_solution[k]

    # Ensure feasibility
    if len(np.unique(new_solution)) != n:
        # If invalid, revert to the original solution
        new_solution = base_solution.copy()

    return new_solution

algorithm: {A novel hybrid local search operator combines a multi-objective selection criterion with a randomized edge-swapping strategy, prioritizing solutions with high potential for improvement while ensuring feasibility and diversity in the search process.}
function:
def select_neighbor(archive: List[Tuple[np.ndarray, Tuple[float, float]]], instance: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_1: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_2: np.ndarray) -> np.ndarray:
    if not archive:
        raise ValueError("Archive is empty")

    # Select a solution with high potential for improvement (e.g., top 20% in both objectives)
    sorted_archive = sorted(archive, key=lambda x: (x[1][0] + x[1][1]))
    candidate_indices = min(2, max(1, len(archive) // 5))
    selected_solution = random.choice(sorted_archive[:candidate_indices])[0].copy()

    # Apply a hybrid local search operator
    new_solution = selected_solution.copy()
    n = len(new_solution)

    # Randomly select a segment to modify
    start = random.randint(0, n - 2)
    end = random.randint(start + 1, min(start + n // 4, n - 1))

    # Extract the segment and reverse it (with probability 0.7)
    if random.random() < 0.7:
        segment = new_solution[start:end]
        new_solution[start:end] = segment[::-1]

    # Randomly swap two edges with probability 0.5
    if random.random() < 0.5:
        i, j = sorted(random.sample(range(n), 2))
        new_solution[i], new_solution[j] = new_solution[j], new_solution[i]

    # Apply a randomized 3-opt move with probability 0.3
    if random.random() < 0.3:
        i, j, k = sorted(random.sample(range(n), 3))
        if random.random() < 0.5:
            new_solution[i:j] = new_solution[i:j][::-1]
        else:
            new_solution[j:k] = new_solution[j:k][::-1]

    # Ensure the solution remains valid (no duplicates)
    unique_nodes = np.unique(new_solution)
    if len(unique_nodes) != n:
        # If invalid, revert to the original solution
        new_solution = selected_solution.copy()

    return new_solution

def select_neighbor(archive: List[Tuple[np.ndarray, Tuple[float, float]]], instance: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_1: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_2: np.ndarray) -> np.ndarray:
    weights = [0.6, 0.4]  # Higher weight for the first objective
    scores = [weights[0] * obj[0] + weights[1] * obj[1] for _, obj in archive]
    selected_idx = np.argmin(scores)
    base_solution = archive[selected_idx][0].copy()

    # Step 2: Apply novel local search strategy
    new_solution = base_solution.copy()
    n = len(new_solution)

    # Randomly select a segment to rotate
    start, end = sorted(random.sample(range(n), 2))
    segment = new_solution[start:end+1]
    rotation = np.random.randint(1, len(segment))
    rotated_segment = np.concatenate([segment[rotation:], segment[:rotation]])
    new_solution[start:end+1] = rotated_segment

    # Randomly select a node to insert elsewhere
    node_pos = np.random.randint(0, n)
    node = new_solution[node_pos]
    new_solution = np.concatenate([new_solution[:node_pos], new_solution[node_pos+1:]])
    insert_pos = np.random.randint(0, len(new_solution))
    new_solution = np.insert(new_solution, insert_pos, node)

    # Randomly swap two edges if they exist
    if n > 2:
        i, j = random.sample(range(n), 2)
        if abs(i - j) > 1:
            new_solution[i], new_solution[j] = new_solution[j], new_solution[i]

    # Ensure feasibility
    if len(np.unique(new_solution)) != n:
        new_solution = base_solution.copy()

    return new_solution

def select_neighbor(archive: List[Tuple[np.ndarray, Tuple[float, float]]], instance: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_1: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_2: np.ndarray) -> np.ndarray:
    base_solution = archive[0][0].copy()
    new_solution = base_solution.copy()
    n = len(new_solution)

    # Novel local search: adaptive segment rotation and edge insertion
    i = np.random.randint(0, n)
    j = np.random.randint(0, n)
    if i > j:
        i, j = j, i

    if j - i > 2:
        # Rotate a segment and insert it at a new position
        segment = new_solution[i:j]
        rotated_segment = np.roll(segment, np.random.randint(1, len(segment)))
        new_solution = np.concatenate([new_solution[:i], rotated_segment, new_solution[j:]])

        # Insert a randomly selected edge from another part of the tour
        k = np.random.randint(0, n)
        if k < i or k > j:
            edge = new_solution[k:k+2]
            new_solution = np.concatenate([new_solution[:k], edge, new_solution[k:]])

    # Ensure feasibility
    if len(np.unique(new_solution)) != n:
        new_solution = base_solution.copy()

    return new_solution
